text:
I failed to initialize the console appender when running on the Jboss 
environment.
The same configuration file use first tested on a simple console application.
When I used this configuration file on the JBoss application I receive the 
following error:

[requestProcessor] log4j:ERROR Could not instance class [org.apache.log4j.Con
soleAppender].
[requestProcessor] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.log4j.ConsoleApp
ender


Somehow it works if the old FileAppender definitions:

# Works with Jboss
log4j.appender.stdout=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
log4j.appender.stdout.File=System.out

# Does not work with JBoss
log4j.appender.stdout=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender

PS,
Log4J configuration file successfully created a Rolling File Appender class 
log4j.category.flow=DEBUG, Flow
log4j.appender.Flow=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.Flow.File=rgpFlow.log

Version:
Windows 2000 Service pack 2
JBoss-2.2.1
Tomcat-3.2.1
creator: ronen.soreq@decell.com
bugzilla@apache.org
text: This looks like a classloading problem in the JBoss environment.
